name: Andira do Brasil - Expanded Identification Key
description: An identification key for 36 species of the genus Andira found in Brazil, based on key morphological features.

features.name: Number of Leaflets per Compound Leaf

entities.name: Andira fraxinifolia Benth.
entities.description: A medium to large tree, prominent in the Atlantic Forest, recognized by its often acuminate leaflets.

entities.name: Andira inermis (W.Wright) Kunth ex DC.
entities.description: A widespread tree, known for its subglobose drupe and insecticidal properties. Leaflets typically acuminate to acute, often with fewer leaflets per compound leaf than A. fraxinifolia.

entities.name: Andira humilis Mart. ex Benth.
entities.description: A distinctive small shrub or subshrub, typically found in savannas (Cerrado), characterized by rounded leaflets and pubescent lower surfaces.

entities.name: Andira surinamensis (Bondt) Splitg. ex Amshoff
entities.description: A tree found in Amazonia and the Guiana Shield, easily identified by its distinctive large, rugose fruits.

entities.name: Andira anthelmia (Vell.) Benth.
entities.description: Known for its medicinal properties, this species typically has acuminate leaflets and a hairy lower surface.

entities.name: Andira coriacea Pulle
entities.description: A species characterized by its somewhat leathery, rounded leaflets and typically glabrous surfaces, often found in Amazonian forests.

entities.name: Andira cubensis Benth.
entities.description: This species can be distinguished by its persistent stipules, often found in a variety of habitats across its range.

entities.name: Andira galactoides Benth.
entities.description: A species with characteristic emarginate leaflet apices and a generally hairy lower leaflet surface, often producing a milky exudate.

entities.name: Andira grandiflora C.DC.
entities.description: Named for its large flowers, this tree features acuminate leaflets with a pubescent lower surface and smaller number of leaflets per compound leaf.

entities.name: Andira legalis (Vell.) Toledo
entities.description: A species known from the Brazilian Atlantic Forest, typically presenting rounded leaflet apices and a glabrous lower surface.

entities.name: Andira macrocarpa Ducke
entities.description: Distinguished by its large, rugose fruits and persistent stipules, often found in Amazonian lowlands.

entities.name: Andira marauensis N.F.O.Mota & A.M.G.Azevedo
entities.description: A recently described species from the Atlantic Forest, characterized by emarginate leaflets and a glabrous lower surface.

entities.name: Andira micrantha Ducke
entities.description: Known for its small flowers and acuminate leaflets, this species is often found in the Amazon biome.

entities.name: Andira nitida Mart. ex Benth.
entities.description: A species noted for its shiny, often rounded leaflets and pubescent lower surfaces, occurring in various Brazilian ecosystems.

entities.name: Andira ormosioides Benth.
entities.description: This tree is characterized by acuminate leaflets and a pubescent lower surface, with rugose fruits, resembling some species of Ormosia.

entities.name: Andira parviflora Ducke
entities.description: A smaller-flowered species with emarginate leaflets and typically glabrous surfaces, native to Amazonian regions.

entities.name: Andira retusa (Poir.) DC.
entities.description: This species exhibits emarginate leaflet apices, a pubescent lower leaflet surface, and notably large, persistent stipules.

entities.name: Andira spectabilis Saldanha & R.Brandão
entities.description: A species that stands out with its rounded leaflet apices, hairy lower surfaces, and distinctly rugose or verrucose fruits.

entities.name: Andira spinulosa Benth.
entities.description: Recognized by its spiny stipules (though these can be minute), acuminate leaflets, and smooth fruits.

entities.name: Andira vermifuga (Mart.) Benth.
entities.description: Known for its vermifuge properties, this species typically has rounded or obtuse leaflets and a glabrous lower surface.

entities.name: Andira villosa Pulle
entities.description: A species characterized by its densely hairy (villous) parts, including pubescent lower leaflet surfaces, and often rugose fruits.

entities.name: Andira bahiensis N.F.O.Mota & A.M.G.Azevedo
entities.description: Endemic to Bahia, often with rounded leaflets and pubescent surfaces, typically found with smooth fruits.

entities.name: Andira cordata N.F.O.Mota & A.M.G.Azevedo
entities.description: Characterized by cordate leaflet bases, typically acuminate apex, and often found with fewer leaflets. Known for its smooth fruits.

entities.name: Andira cujabensis Benth.
entities.description: Occurs in the Pantanal and Cerrado, often recognized by larger, rugose fruits, and generally glabrous foliage.

entities.name: Andira galeottiana Standl.
entities.description: A widespread species in Central and South America, often with acuminate leaflets and varying indumentum, generally smooth fruits.

entities.name: Andira klugii R.H.Schery
entities.description: An Amazonian species, known for its smaller habit and often rounded, glabrous leaflets. Produces smooth fruits.

entities.name: Andira laurifolia Benth.
entities.description: Distinguished by its laurel-like, often acuminate leaves, typically glabrous surfaces, and numerous leaflets. Fruits are usually smooth.

entities.name: Andira longipes N.F.O.Mota & A.M.G.Azevedo
entities.description: Named for its long petiolules, this species features acuminate leaflets and a hairy lower surface. Typically bears smooth fruits.

entities.name: Andira macrothyrsa Ducke
entities.description: Characterized by large thyrsoid inflorescences and often rugose fruits, with acuminate, glabrous leaflets, prominent in Amazonian forests.

entities.name: Andira parvifoliola N.F.O.Mota & A.M.G.Azevedo
entities.description: Has relatively small leaflets, often emarginate at the apex, and a glabrous surface. Typically found with smooth fruits.

entities.name: Andira peregrina Mart. ex Benth.
entities.description: A widely distributed species, often showing rounded leaflet apices and pubescent lower surfaces. Characterized by smooth fruits.

entities.name: Andira punctata (Vell.) J.F.Macbr.
entities.description: Named for dotted glands on its leaves, with acuminate leaflets and typically glabrous surfaces. Often possesses rugose fruits.

entities.name: Andira rosea Benth.
entities.description: Often recognized by its pinkish flowers and generally acuminate, pubescent leaflets. Typically has smooth fruits.

entities.name: Andira tapajosa N.F.O.Mota & A.M.G.Azevedo
entities.description: Originating from the Tapajós river region, with rounded leaflets and glabrous surfaces, typically bearing smooth fruits.

entities.name: Andira zenkeri Taub.
entities.description: Known for its occurrence in parts of Brazil, features often include acuminate leaflets, pubescent lower surfaces, and distinctly large, persistent stipules. Fruits are typically smooth.

entities.name: Andira verruculosa Ducke
entities.description: Distinctive for its very verrucose (warty) fruits, accompanied by acuminate leaflets and glabrous surfaces.
